isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - AIR FITTINGS - PUSH-TO-CONNECT TYPE FITTING

warning.para: A sudden release of air pressure can cause personal injury or damage to equipment. To prevent injury or equipment damage, exhaust the vehicle air tanks.

caution.para: Make sure only 5/32 inch air lines are used with push-to-connect fittings. Using sizes other than 5/32 inch can cause air leaks or damage to fittings.

step1.para: Exhaust the vehicle air tanks before continuing.
Press the release sleeve down while pulling the air line from the fitting as shown in Figure 6.
Inspect the fitting for damage or wear. Remove and replace as necessary.

figure.caption: Figure 6. Removing Air Line From Fitting

step1.para: Check the threads of the fitting for thread sealant. If no sealant is present, apply Loctite 242 or equivalent.

Inspect the air line for burrs or deformed areas. Trim the air line if necessary using a sharp razor blade. The cut must be smooth and square. If the tubing end is deformed or butted, the internal O-ring in the fitting will be damaged when the air line is inserted.

Push the air line into the fitting. It should insert approximately 3/4 inch. If it does not insert far enough or is difficult to insert, the fitting may be damaged and should be replaced. After inserting, give the air line a slight tug to make sure the line stays in place. If the air line does not stay in place, replace the fitting.
